intro: Entadopsis abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian entadopsis, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The plant has been studied for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its efficacy.
